articles.description: Jessica Pegula takes on Madison Keys for a place in the US Open quarter-finals, followed by Britain's Jack Draper against Andrey Rublev - follow live.
articles.title: US Open: Pegula trails Keys in first set - radio & text

articles.description: Third seed Jessica Pegula leaves the court in tears after a frustrating US Open fourth-round defeat by Madison Keys.
articles.title: Pegula leaves court in tears after Keys loss

articles.description: Jack Grealish and Trent Alexander-Arnold withdraw from the England squad for upcoming games against Ukraine and Scotland because of injury.
articles.title: Grealish and Alexander-Arnold out of England squad

articles.description: Lock Bastien Chalureau denies accusations he is a racist after being called up as injury cover in France's World Cup squad.
articles.title: France lock Chalureau says he is 'not a racist'

articles.description: A 42-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of assault after an alleged incident during Arsenal's 3-1 win over Manchester United on Sunday
articles.title: Arrest made after alleged assault on Keane at PL match

articles.description: Newly turned professional Ludvig Aberg will make his Ryder Cup bow for Europe after being named in captain Luke Donald's six wildcard picks on Monday.
articles.title: Aberg gets wildcard spot in Europe's Ryder Cup team

articles.description: Match of the Day 2's Jermaine Jenas and Stephen Warnock discuss Manchester United's set-piece problem which led to Declan Rice's late goal.
articles.title: How Rice punished 'criminal' Man Utd error

articles.description: Carlos Sainz thanks Milan police after the Ferrari driver was reportedly the target of a robbery after Sunday's Italian Grand Prix.
articles.title: Sainz thanks police after alleged robbery attempt

articles.description: Former Spain defender Sergio Ramos returns to boyhood club Sevilla, 18 years after leaving for Real Madrid.
articles.title: Ramos returns to boyhood club Sevilla after 18 years

articles.description: Spain's men's players condemn the "unacceptable behaviour" of national federation president Luis Rubiales.
articles.title: Spain men's players condemn Rubiales behaviour
